events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision involving their car and filed a claim for damages sustained on April 30th.
After initial review, the claim was categorised as an Auto Accident claim due to the nature of the collision and vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the investigation and processing of the auto accident claim.
The claimant was contacted and informed that their accident claim has been officially acknowledged and is under review.
The claimant was asked to submit the police report, vehicle registration, and photos of the damages for further assessment.
All requested documentation including the police report and images of the damaged vehicle were submitted by the claimant.
The investigation into the circumstances of the auto accident was initiated to determine liability and assess damage costs.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the claimant was not at fault and damage assessment was finalized.
A settlement offer covering the repair costs and a rental vehicle allowance was presented to the claimant for approval.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of their accident claim.
The claim was officially approved based on all documentation and agreement on the proposed compensation amount.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was processed and transferred to the claimant's bank account.
Following payment issuance, the auto accident claim file was closed successfully with no outstanding issues.
